snippet: The 30 or so participants say their objective is to build toward a time when the political landscape may have shifted enough that a bill could pass Congress.
abstract: Senate Democratic leader Harry Reid takes to Senate floor to kick off nearly 15-hour climate-change talkathon by nearly 30 Senate Democrats, part of campaign by new 'climate caucus' to make it politically urgent issue; all-night session is latest effort by group, working with parallel House caucus, to elevate issue of global warming.
lead_paragraph: The 30 or so participants say their objective is to build toward a time when the political landscape may have shifted enough that a bill could pass Congress.

headline.main: Senate Democrats’ All-Nighter Flags Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Senate Democrats’ All-Nighter Flags Climate Change
